intro: Warczewiczella marginata, commonly known as the marginated warczewiczella, is a rare and lesser-known species of flowering plant. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is native to specific regions in South America. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, urn-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
